body_html:
We're deprecating StochasticTensor (ST). As we move our code to github/tensorflow/probability, we'll ensure that no functionality is lost; you will however have to port your existing use of StochasticTensor. To that end, our new design pattern is to either use a new version of Edward (which will be checked into github/tensorflow/probability) or to write your probabilistic model as a callable and pass that as argument to functions.

For example, previously you could use a VIMCO loss with ST. The same functionality exists as part of:
https://github.com/tensorflow/probability/blob/master/tensorflow_probability/python/vi/csiszar_divergence.py#L885

To that end, our new design pattern is to either use a new version of Edward (which will be checked into github/tensorflow/probability) or to write your probabilistic model as a callable and pass that as argument to functions.
For example, previously you could use a VIMCO loss with ST. The same functionality exists as part of:
https://github.com/tensorflow/probability/blob/master/tensorflow_probability/python/vi/csiszar_divergence.py#L885
body:
We're deprecating StochasticTensor (ST).  As we move our code to github/tensorflow/probability, we'll ensure that no functionality is lost; you will however have to port your existing use of StochasticTensor.  To that end, our new design pattern is to either use a new version of Edward (which will be checked into github/tensorflow/probability) or to write your probabilistic model as a callable and pass that as argument to functions.

For example, previously you could use a VIMCO loss with ST. The same functionality exists as part of:
https://github.com/tensorflow/probability/blob/master/tensorflow_probability/python/vi/csiszar_divergence.py#L885
